glosses: to wake up, to come to oneself; or (in the negative), to act grumpily, to have a bad temper

etymology: From afyon (“opium”) + -u (possessive suffix) + patlamak (“to burst”), from the practice of certain opium addicts during the Ottoman Empire era ingesting pills filled with opium during suhur while fasting during the month of Ramadan. The pills would burst in their stomachs at some point later in the day, satisfying the adddicts and possibly making them less irritable (similar to the effects of fully waking up).
